articles.title: Up 17% in 2025, Has Warren Buffett-Led Berkshire Hathaway Run Up Too Far, Too Fast?
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B) is up 17% year to date (YTD) at the time of this writing -- handily crushing an 8.3% decline in the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC).  Berkshire Hathaway has been on such a tear that it is one of the top 40 best-performing S&P 500 components in 2025.  Hovering around an all-time high, Berkshire's market cap is now $1.15 trillion -- making it the sixth-most valuable U.S. company behind Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), Microsoft, Nvidia, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms.

articles.title: Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) Dips 14% In One Week As Trade Tensions Impact Market
articles.content: Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) recently integrated CONNEQT Health's arterial biomarkers into its Health app, marking a significant step towards enhancing health management capabilities. Despite this development, Apple's stock dropped 14% over the past week. This decline aligned with broader market turbulence, as the Nasdaq entered bear market territory amid escalating tariff tensions between the U.S. and China, leading to significant declines in major indexes, such as the Dow dropping 2,200 points...

articles.title: Think You Know Apple? Here's 1 Lesser-Known Fact You Shouldn't Overlook.
articles.content: With a market capitalization of just under $3 trillion, Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) holds the title of the world's most valuable company.  Given all that, nearly every investor will be familiar with Apple.  Apple generated $391 billion in sales in its fiscal 2024 (which ended Sept. 28).

articles.title: Apple’s collapse proves cosying up to Trump is no guarantee of safety
articles.content: For years, Tim Cook has become something of a horse-whisperer figure in his dealings with Donald Trump.
